ingredients.content: 200 g preserved red peppers, cut in pieces
700 g water, boiling, plus extra for soaking
200 g tinned sardines in oil, drained (2 x 120 g tins)

preparations.content: Place onions and oil in mixing bowl then chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then sauté <b>5 min/95°C/speed <b>. Meanwhile, soak sultanas in boiling water.
Add peppers, garlic, paprika, fennel and mint, chop <b>3 sec/speed 8<b> then cook <b>2 min/95°C/speed <b>.
Add water, fish stock and cinnamon stick then simmer <b>10 min/98°C//speed <b>. Leave to stand for 5 minutes.
Add sardines, peas and reserved drained sultanas. Stir with spatula then replace lid and leave to rest for another 5 minutes.
Remove cinnamon stick then season to taste with salt, pepper and lemon juice. Serve sprinkled with toasted almonds.
